results.title: The Legend of Robin Hood: black arrow
results.creator_credit: Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description: Introduced by John-Michael Howson, this tape includes two tales for the family to enjoy. “The Legend of Robin Hood”; King Richard leaves for England to crusade in the Holy Land. He leaves the kingdom in the hands of his brother, Prince John. All does not go well however, and Prince John and his Barons use the power recently invested in them to increase their estates at the expense of the citizens. Only one citizen dares to protest against their shoddy behaviour; Robin of Locksley, who becomes an outlaw and adopts the name, Robin Hood. Directed by Zoran Janic. “Black arrow”; Squire Richard Shelton, heir to the Turnstall Estate sets out to join the Lancastrian Army. On his way he meets the mysterious brotherhood of the Black Arrow and discovers startling news. His guardian, Sir Daniel Brackley, is plotting to steal his estate and may have been involved in the death of Richard’s father. Directed by Leif Gram.

results.title: The Legend of Mark Twain
results.creator_credit: Daniel Wilson, Jules Power Productions, Benchmark Films and Karl Genus
results.brief_description: Follows Samuel Clemens’ life and career on the American literary scene and dramatises selections from two of his well-known classics - “The Celebrated jumping frog of Calaveras County” and “The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn”. Cast includes David Wayne.

results.title: The Legend of King Arthur
results.creator_credit: Ken Riddington, BBC-TV and Rodney Bennett
results.brief_description: The legend of King Arthur, a tale of love, sorrow, courage and endeavour set in the cruel and barbaric Dark Ages, where magic still weaves its mystic influence over the affairs of men and kings. Merlin the mysterious old wizard has a vision of a new age of justice and chivalry and chooses young Arthur, son of Uther, to carry the torch of enlightenment.

results.title: The Legend of Damien Parer
results.creator_credit: Kip Porteous, ABC-TV (Australia) and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: A record of the life and work of war photographer Damien Parer who, after working with the Commonwealth Film Unit, left with the first A.I.F. contingent for the Middle East. Includes extracts from some of his films and interviews with his wife and other close associates. (Awards: Winner of Silver Award, Documentary category, Australian Film Awards, 1965)

results.title: The Legend of Byamee
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Contemporary aboriginal bark paintings from Arnhem Land illustrate the story of the decline of the Aborigines. Byamee, a sky hero from the Dream Time, made the first earth men and taught them all they know, but the black people did not follow his instructions and the white devils took over the continent.

results.title: The Left wall of Cenotaph Corner
results.brief_description: Cenotaph Corner in North Wales is a rock climber’s challenge. Actual footage of a climb up this rock face illustrates the magnitude of skill necessary. The film discusses the type of equipment used in rock climbing.

results.title: The Leaving of Liverpool. [Parts 1 & 2]
results.creator_credit: Steve Knapman, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC, Michael Jenkins, John Alsop and Sue Smith
results.brief_description:
Two English children - Lily (Christine Tremarco) and Bert (Kevin Jones) meet at the Star of the Sea orphanage in Liverpool. Lily has been placed there by her impoverished mother who needs to get on her feet financially, her pain at being separated is eased when she meets the spritely and nationalistic Bert. Together with the shy, hearing impaired Wilson (David Kaff), the 3 decide to fly the flag for the empire and agree to go to Australia, their heads filled with ideas of forming a unified family in a warmer climate. Part one principally traces the fortunes of Wilson and Bert. Separated from Lily on arrival in Australia, they are taken to a religious rural establishment, St Bedes, where the boys are faced with gruelling manual labour, and a lack of mental stimulation or education. Bert is befriended by Brother O’Neill, while Wilson is subject to bullying. Part two follows the rebellious Lily who is sent to a girl’s home in preparation for domestic work, then travels to Sydney with the kindly Harry (John Hargreaves). Lily eventually tracks down Bert and the two attempt to re-establish a relationship that is hindered by their respective migrant experiences and changing fortunes in regards to being united with their families. From 1945, 10,000 children such as Lily and Bert were sent to Australia alone, under a child migration system which saw the removal of 130,000 youngsters from Britain. The programme took place until 1967.
This version of events led to some of the migrants coming forward with their stories of abuse and neglect. Dubbed “The Forgotten Australians”, an official apology was made to them by Prime Minister of Australia, Kevin Rudd, in 2009.

results.title: The League of Nations: the first experiment
results.creator_credit: George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Described as, by the titles, “An account of the first attempt by nations to build an organisation to maintain the peace.” Contains original footage from WWI re the armistice and political accounts of movements during the war.

results.title: The League of Nations: the decline and fall
results.creator_credit: George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Describes the formation of the League of Nations shortly after the end of WWI. Also outlines related organisations such as the World Court and the International Labor Organisation. Describes the activities of Hitler, Mussilini and the Japanese invasion of China. The end of the League and the formation of the United Nations is also shown.
